alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 6:23AM HST until July 19 at 9:15AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County * Until 915 AM HST. * At 623 AM HST, radar indicated persistent rainfall along the slopes of the Kau District. Hawaii County Civil Defense reported that Wood Valley Road has been closed due to flooding. Flooding is also expected to close the Hawaii Belt Road in the Kawa Flats area near Punaluu, and Kaalaiki Road near Pahala. Rainfall will continue over the Kau District through the morning. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wood Valley, Pahala, Punaluu Beach, Kawa Flats, Naalehu, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Waiohinu, Hawaii Volcanoes Park Kahuku Unit and Discovery Harbor. This warning may need to be extended beyond 915 AM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
